sen.e: With "Heiki-ho" (the method to place the 24 traditional seasonal divisions of a year by making equal time intervals), the doyo days of summer are figured out the 18 days before "risshu" (the first day of autumn), and with recent popular "Teiki-ho" (the method to place the 24 traditional seasonal divisions of a year by equally dividing the ecliptic into 24 parts, calculating the date when the sun passes each of those parts, and setting the seasonal divisions into the date), the doyo days of summer fall on the dates that the sun passes the the obliquity of 117°- 135°, and they are figured out about 18 days around risshu.
